IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDescription: TO MAKE THE BIBLE AVAILABLE TO EVERY PERSON IN A LANGUAGE AND FORMAT EACH CAN UNDERSTAND AND AFFORD, SO ALL PEOPLE MAY EXPERIENCE ITS LIFE- CHANGING MESSAGE.
IRS990.MissionDescription: INTRODUCTION: AMERICAN BIBLE SOCIETY WAS FOUNDED IN NEW YORK CITY IN 1816. FOR MORE THAN 194 YEARS, IT HAS BEEN A CATALYST FOR GIVING GOD'S WORD TO MILLIONS OF PEOPLE, BOTH IN THE UNITED STATES AND AROUND THE WORLD. ITS MISSION TODAY CONTINUES THE EARLY VISION: MAKING THE BIBLE AVAILABLE TO EVERY PERSON IN A LANGUAGE AND FORMAT EACH CAN UNDERSTAND AND AFFORD, SO ALL PEOPLE MAY EXPERIENCE ITS LIFE-CHANGING MESSAGE. AMERICAN BIBLE SOCIETY BRINGS THE LOVE OF JESUS CHRIST AND THE LIFE-CHANGING MESSAGE OF THE BIBLE WHERE IT'S NEEDED MOST. IT CHALLENGES THE NOTION THAT THE BIBLE IS A DUSTY, OUTDATED RULEBOOK. BY SERVING TODAY'S GENERATIONS, AMERICAN BIBLE SOCIETY PROVIDES SCRIPTURE RESOURCES WHERE A TRANSLATION IS LACKING, ACCESS IS BLOCKED, A CRISIS IS PRESENT OR LIFE DOESN'T MAKE SENSE. AMERICAN BIBLE SOCIETY'S NATIONAL SCRIPTURE ENGAGEMENT CAMPAIGN-- UNCOVER THE WORD--WILL SERVE CHURCHES WITH CUSTOMIZED BIBLE RESOURCES FOR SCRIPTURE ENGAGEMENT. IT ALSO WILL SEEK TO REACH NEW GENERATIONS W
IRS990.Description: NATIONAL MINISTRIES: WORKING ACROSS THE UNITED STATES, PROGRAMS FOCUS ON ESSENTIAL BIBLE ENGAGEMENT AND EMBODYING HOPE WITH Biblical translation and SCHOLARSHIP PROVIDED BY THE NIDA INSTITUTE AND DISTRIBUTION PROVIDED BY BIBLES.COM. >> ESSENTIAL ENGAGEMENT: DELIVERS GOD'S WORD TO HELP MAKE SENSE OF LIFE. FOSTERING BIBLE ENGAGEMENT WITH 2,145,943 LIVES TOUCHED THIS LAST YEAR. HIGHLIGHTS OF THIS WORK INCLUDE: AMERICA'S ARMED FORCES - FOR 194 YEARS, AMERICAN BIBLE SOCIETY HAS EQUIPPED SOLDIERS ON THE FRONT LINES AND VETERANS AT HOME WITH TOOLS THAT HELP MEET THEIR SPIRITUAL NEEDS. DURING FY 2010, American Bible Society INTRODUCED TWO NEW MINISTRY TOOLS: "ESSENTIAL 100" AND "ENGAGE YOUR STRENGTHS." "ESSENTIAL 100," THE NEWLY CUSTOMIZED AND WEB-ENABLED MILITARY E100 PACKAGE, SERVES THE PRESSING NEEDS OF military CHAPLAINS, WHO WILL USE THE KIT TO ENCOURAGE SOLDIERS TO READ THE BIBLE REGULARLY. "ENGAGE YOUR STRENGTHS" IS DESIGNED FOR ACTIVE DUTY SOLDIERS TO DEVELOP LIFELONG HABITS THAT SHAPE BIBLICALLY GROUNDED CHARACTER FORMATION. IT WAS PRAISED BY THE ARMY CHIEF OF CHAPLAINS FOR ITS POTENTIAL TO TRANSFORM THE CULTURE OF CHAPLAINCY, AS WELL AS THE ARMY AND ITS EXTENDED COMMUNITY. AMERICAN BIBLE SOCIETY REMAINS DEEPLY COMMITTED TO THE VETERANS WHO SAFEGUARDED THIS COUNTRY'S INVALUABLE FREEDOMS. IN FY 2010, American Bible Society TOUCHED THE LIVES OF 135,000 MILITARY PERSONNEL AND THEIR FAMILIES THROUGH THE "GOD UNDERSTANDS" SCRIPTURE PORTION SERIES. THIS SERIES ADDRESSES ISSUES VETERANS COMMONLY FACE: ANGER, GUILT, DOUBT, FAIRNESS, FEAR OF DEATH, HOPELESSNESS, MEANINGLESSNESS AND SADNESS. MUSICAL PARTNERS - AMERICAN BIBLE SOCIETY PARTNERED WITH MUSICIANS IN FY 2010 TO PROMOTE A DAILY DISCOVERY OF GOD'S WORD, INCLUDING THE CHRISTIAN BAND, "SIDEWALK PROPHETS." DURING THEIR TOUR, MEMBERS OF SIDEWALK PROPHETS INVITED 300,000 YOUTH TO JOIN AMERICAN BIBLE SOCIETY'S "GET THE TRUTH" CAMPAIGN. THIS CAMPAIGN IS DESIGNED TO FOSTER DAILY EXPLORATION OF GOD'S WORD, STARTING WITH FREE SCRIPTURE-BASED TEXT MESSAGES. MORE THAN 85,000 YOUTH SIGNED UP FOR THE CHALLENGE, AND NEARLY 10 PERCENT OF THOSE WHO RECEIVED THE MOBILE SCRIPTURE TEXTS OPTED TO DIG DEEPER INTO GOD'S WORD BY EXPLORING American Bible Society'S DIGITAL MINISTRY TOOLS. AMERICAN BIBLE SOCIETY ALSO PARTNERED WITH ANOTHER WELL-KNOWN CHRISTIAN BAND, PILLAR, TO SPARK SCRIPTURE ENGAGEMENT AMONG AMERICAN YOUTH. AS PART OF THIS JOINT COLLABORATION, American Bible Society DEVELOPED "CONFESSIONS," A FIVE-WEEK BIBLE STUDY TOOL THAT ADDRESSES SALIENT ISSUES AFFECTING YOUNG PEOPLE. THE AMERICAN CHURCH - RESOURCING CHURCHES WITH ESSENTIAL TOOLS AND PROGRAMS, AMERICAN BIBLE SOCIETY RELAUNCHED "BIBLE SUNDAY," A 95-YEAR-OLD PROGRAM, AS A 21ST CENTURY BIBLE ENGAGEMENT RESOURCE, "BIBLE SUNDAY" REACHED SOME 14,524 CHURCHES, WHICH PARTICIPATED IN THIS PROGRAM. FURTHER SUPPORTING THE CHURCH, AMERICAN BIBLE SOCIETY BROUGHT TOGETHER LEADERS FROM THE AMERICAN CHURCH TO EXPLORE WAYS TO ENGAGE OUR SOCIETY WITH GOD'S WORD, LEADING TO A FRESH RELEASE OF CHRISTIAN COMPASSION. THIS INCLUDED A SPRING GATHERING OF THE NATIONAL CHURCH LEADERS SUMMIT. LEADERS FROM ACROSS THE CHURCH EMBRACED THE CHALLENGES OF EFFECTIVE BIBLE ENGAGEMENT AND RESOLVED TO TURN THE TIDE ON THE GROWING CRISIS FACING OUR NATION. TESTIFYING TO THE DEEP SOLIDARITY AMONG CHRISTIANS, HIS ALL HOLINESS ECUMENICAL PATRIARCH BARTHOLOMEW CAME TO BIBLE HOUSE BEFORE VISITING THE WHITE HOUSE IN OCTOBER 2009. HIS visit TO THE BIBLE HOUSE IN NEW YORK RE-EMPHASIZED THE SHARED COMMITMENTS OF American Bible Society AND THE ORTHODOX CHURCH TO REACH OUT TO PEOPLE WITH THE PROMISES OF GOD'S WORD. EMBRACING THE ROMAN CATHOLIC COMMUNITY, American Bible Society HOSTED HIS EXCELLENCY, THE MOST REV. NIKOLA ETEROVIC, SECRETARY GENERAL OF THE SYNOD OF BISHOPS, VATICAN CITY STATE. THE ARCHBISHOP PRESENTED A TALK AT BIBLE HOUSE TO EDUCATE ROMAN CATHOLICS ABOUT THE OCTOBER 2008 SYNOD OF BISHOPS ON THE BIBLE. THE DIGITAL GENERATION - AMERICAN BIBLE SOCIETY LAUNCHED JOURNEYS.AMERICABIBLE.ORG AS A WAY TO INVITE GOD TO SPEAK TO PEOPLE'S HEARTS. USING THIS DIGITAL MARKETPLACE OF FREE, TOPICAL BIBLE JOURNEYS, VISITORS CAN CHOOSE THEIR PREFERRED MEANS OF COMMUNICATION - TEXT, E-MAIL, WEB, AUDIO OR PDF - TO GAIN ANYWHERE-ANYTIME ACCESS TO GOD'S WORD. American Bible Society ALSO LAUNCHED BIBLE SEARCH (BIBLESEARCH.AMERICANBIBLE.ORG), A VERSE AND TOPICAL SEARCH TOOL IN WHICH PEOPLE CAN FIND, COMPARE, TAG, NOTE, SHARE AND DIG DEEPER INTO SCRIPTURE RESOURCES. AMERICAN BIBLE SOCIETY'S SOCIAL MEDIA EFFORTS HAVE TOUCHED TENS OF THOUSANDS OF YOUTH AND ADULTS WITH THE HOPE OF GOD'S WORD. MOVING INTO PUBLIC NETWORKS, IT HAS INVITED NEW AUDIENCES TO CONNECT WITH THE American BIBLE SOCIETY AND EACH OTHER THROUGH A RANGE OF SCRIPTURE, PRAYER AND THEMATIC OFFERINGS. TO THAT END, MORE THAN 70,000 USERS JOINED THE American Bible Society CIRCLE OF PRAYER, AN ONLINE MINISTRY TOOL ACCESSIBLE THROUGH THE SOCIAL MEDIA PLATFORM, FACEBOOK. HERE, MEMBERS ARE INVITED TO POST PRAYER REQUESTS, NEEDS AND PRAISE ON A "PRAYER WALL." American Bible Society WANTED TO REACH 50,000 USERS WITHIN A YEAR'S TIME, BUT 70,000 USERS JOINED IN JUST TWO MONTHS, DEMONSTRATING THE POTENTIAL OF DIGITAL MINISTRY TO REACH THOSE LOOKING FOR WAYS TO CONNECT WITH OTHERS. LOOKING ABROAD, AMERICAN BIBLE SOCIETY SAW A FRESH WAVE OF BIBLE ENGAGEMENT AMONG CATHOLIC TEENAGERS. NEARLY 1.5 MILLION TEENAGERS IN LATIN AMERICA HAVE BEEN INVOLVED IN DAILY ONLINE LECTIO DIVINA DEVOTIONS THROUGH AN INTERACTIVE, ONLINE WEEKLY PROGRAM. THIS DEMONSTRATES A MODERN IMPACT FOR LECTIO DIVINA, AN ANCIENT METHOD OF PRAYERFULLY STUDYING SCRIPTURE. THROUGH OUR PARTNERSHIP AND SUPPORT, THE MUSEUM OF BIBLICAL ART CONTINUES TO BRING TO THE PUBLIC AN INTERPRETATION OF ART THROUGH THE LENS OF BIBLICAL RELIGIONS AND AN UNDERSTANDING OF RELIGION THROUGH ITS ARTISTIC MANIFESTATIONS. MORE THAN 15,000 PEOPLE HAVE VISITED ITS EXHIBITS SINCE IT OPENED. In January 2010, ABS agreed to loan MOBIA (Museum of the Biblical Arts) a significant portion of its rare scripture collection for the purposes of public exhibition and display. In the fiscal year 2010, Bibles from this collection were publicly displayed for the first time in nearly two hundred years in an exhibition entitled "A Light to the Nations: America's Earliest Bibles (1532-1864)." >> EMBODYING HOPE: PROGRAMS FOR GOD'S WORD TO RESTORE BROKEN LIVES ACROSS AMERICA, WITH 316,065 LIVES TOUCHED THIS LAST YEAR. HIGHLIGHTS OF THIS WORK INCLUDE: AMERICAN BIBLE SOCIETY REACHES OUT TO THOSE WHO ARE IN CRISIS AND DESPAIR BY BRINGING GOD'S MESSAGE OF HOPE TO THEM. STRUGGLING CHILDREN - "MISSION: LITERACY" IS A MULTICULTURAL LITERACY PROGRAM THAT USES BIBLICALLY BASED INSTRUCTION MATERIALS TO HELP AT-RISK CHILDREN MAKE UP LOST GROUND IN BASIC READING SKILLS. CHILDREN RECEIVE THE DUAL BENEFIT OF LEARNING TO READ AND LEARNING ABOUT GOD'S LOVE. A JOINT PROGRAM OF AMERICAN BIBLE SOCIETY AND THE SALVATION ARMY, "MISSION: LITERACY" BEGAN IN 2006. SINCE THEN, 579 PEOPLE FROM 167 DIFFERENT SALVATION ARMY CORPS HAVE BEEN TRAINED IN TEACHING THE PROGRAM. IN FY 2010, NEARLY 663 CHILDREN WERE REGISTERED IN 32 DIFFERENT CORPS, WITH LESSONS BEING TAUGHT IN 107 TUTORING GROUPS IN 14 STATES AROUND THE COUNTRY. American Bible Society plans to expand this program to reach 20 million people over the next decade with God's Word and the gift of reading. EXPANDING ITS REACH, SEVERAL CORPS USE "MISSION: LITERACY" TO TEACH ADULTS TO READ, AS WELL AS HELP IMMIGRANTS (HISPANICS, LAOTIANS, VIETNAMESE, HMONG AND MICRONESIANS) LEARN ENGLISH AS A SECOND LANGUAGE. REACHING PAST THE UNITED STATES, THE "MISSION: LITERACY" PROGRAM DEBUTED IN MAJURO, MARSHALL ISLANDS. GHANA AND KENYA WERE ADDITIONAL STARTUP SITES IN FY 2010. "BREAD TODAY" SUPPORTS PEOPLE BOTH PHYSICALLY AND SPIRITUALLY THROUGH SCRIPTURE RESOURCES AND PRACTICAL PROVISIONS SUCH AS FOOD, WATER, MEDICAL AND DENTAL CARE. THROUGH LOCAL CHURCH NETWORKS, "BREAD TODAY" HELPS FAMILIES WHO ARE TRYING TO COPE WITH THE AFTERMATH OF NATURAL DISASTERS OR DAY-TO-DAY PRESSURES, SUCH AS UNEMPLOYMENT AND STRESS. PROJECTS FOCUSED ON THE HOMELESS ALSO EMPOWER INDIVIDUALS TO TRANSFORM THEIR LIVES BY EXCHANGING HOMELESSNESS AND SPIRITUAL BROKENNESS FOR SOUND CHRISTIAN LIVING WITH THE WORD OF GOD. ONE OF THE KEY PARTNERS FOR THE "BREAD TODAY" PROGRAM IS OPERATION COMPASSION, A NONPROFIT DISASTER RELIEF ORGANIZATION WHICH FOCUSES THREE PRIORITIES: (1) RESPONDING TO NATURAL DISASTERS NATIONALLY AND AROUND THE WORLD; (2) PROVIDING INSPIRATION, INFORMATION, TRAINING AND RESOURCES TO HELP MOBILIZE CHURCHES, INDIVIDUALS AND COMMUNITY GROUPS TO PROVIDE FOOD AND BASIC NECESSITIES TO THE POOR AND NEEDY; (3) CONCENTRATING ON INTERNATIONAL DISTRIBUTION TO WIDOWS, SINGLE MOTHERS AND CHILDREN. HOMELESS AND WITHOUT SHELTER - IN PARTNERSHIP WITH BOWERY MISSION IN NEW YORK CITY, AMERICAN BIBLE SOCIETY IS BRINGING THE HOPE OF GOD'S WORD TO THE CITY'S HOMELESS. BY ENGAGING WITH THE BIBLE THROUGH CHAPEL SERVICES, DISCIPLESHIP PROGRAMS

Activity2.Description: INTERNATIONAL MINISTRIES: REACHING ACROSS OUR NATION'S BORDERS, AMERICAN BIBLE SOCIETY MINISTERS TO THE WORLD most effectively in collaboration WITH ITS CLOSE NETWORK OF INTERNATIONAL PARTNERS. >> INTERNATIONAL BIBLE IMPACT AND EVERY HEART LANGUAGE: PROGRAMS FOCUSING ON GOD'S WORD FOR THE WORLD AND GOD'S WORD IN EVERY LANGUAGE, TOUCHING THE LIVES OF 5,661,740 PEOPLE THIS LAST YEAR. AMERICAN BIBLE SOCIETY EXTENDS ITS BIBLE OUTREACH INTERNATIONALLY MOST PRINCIPALLY THROUGH THE UNITED BIBLE SOCIETIES (UBS), A FELLOWSHIP OF 147 NATIONAL BIBLE SOCIETIES. AMERICAN BIBLE SOCIETY WAS INSTRUMENTAL IN FOUNDING THIS GLOBAL FELLOWSHIP IN THE INTEREST OF GREATER MINISTRY IMPACT AND EFFICIENCY. BEGUN IN 1946 WITH 12 MEMBER SOCIETIES, UBS HAS GROWN AND ALLOWS GRASSROOTS COLLABORATION WITH ALL CHRISTIAN CHURCHES AND CHURCH-RELATED ORGANIZATIONS FOR BIBLE OUTREACH IN MORE THAN 200 COUNTRIES AND TERRITORIES. HIGHLIGHTS OF THIS WORK INCLUDE: CHINA - IN APRIL, THE CHINA CHRISTIAN COUNCIL, THE NATIONAL COMMITTEE OF THREE SELF PATRIOTIC MOVEMENT OF THE PROTESTANT CHURCHES (CCC/TSPM) AND THE UNITED BIBLE SOCIETIES CELEBRATED 25 YEARS OF SUCCESSFUL PARTNERSHIP. THIS PARTNERSHIP, SAID THE CHAIRMAN OF UBS ASIA PACIFIC AREA BOARD, HAS BROUGHT "BLESSING AND LIFE AND HOPE TO MILLIONS OF PEOPLE ALL AROUND THE WORLD." American Bible Society CONTINUES ITS WORK WITH THESE GROUPS TO SUPPORT A PAPER SUBSIDY THAT PRINTS MILLIONS OF BIBLES AT AFFORDABLE PRICES. EXPANDING THE REACH OF BIBLE DISTRIBUTION PROJECTS, AMITY PRINTING COMPANY PRINTS THE BIBLES THROUGHOUT THE YEAR, AND CCC/TSPM COORDINATES SALES AND DISTRIBUTION TO VARIOUS CONGREGATIONS. HAITI - AFTER A 7.0-MAGNITUDE EARTHQUAKE STRUCK PORT-AU-PRINCE ON JAN. 12, 2010, AMERICAN BIBLE SOCIETY immediately reached out to its strong partner organizations in a MULTILATERAL COLLABORATION TO BRING physical HELP AND spiritual HOPE TO THE PEOPLE OF HAITI. IN PARTNERSHIP WITH WATER MISSIONS INTERNATIONAL, OPERATION COMPASSION AND SEVERAL KEY BIBLE AGENCIES, American Bible Society HELPED DELIVER 50,000 GALLONS OF CLEAN WATER AND THE LIVING HOPE OF GOD'S WORD TO THE PEOPLE OF HAITI. WORKING ALONGSIDE ONE HOPE, BACK TO THE BIBLE AND FAITH COMES BY HEARING, AMERICAN BIBLE SOCIETY HELPED RESOURCE THE HAITIAN BIBLE SOCIETY'S EFFORT TO GET 200,000 COPIES OF THE SCRIPTURE PORTION, GOD IS OUR SHELTER AND STRENGTH, AND 3,000 AUDIO NEW TESTAMENT PROCLAIMERS AND 50,000 FRENCH AND HAITIAN BIBLES TO HAITI. While remaining focused on our area of expertise, the Bible, the American Bible Society's collaboration with other partners ensured that our spiritual help was delivered alongside a basic life necessity, water. DEMOCRATIC REPUBLIC OF CONGO - SEEKING HOPE FOR THE DEMOCRATIC REPUBLIC OF THE CONGO (DRC) AND THE CENTRAL AFRICA'S RIFT VALLEY, AMERICAN BIBLE SOCIETY HELD A SUMMIT AND INVITED GUESTS FROM NINE NATIONAL ORGANIZATIONS TO ASSESS AND ADDRESS KEY BIBLE-BASED INTERVENTIONS FOR EDUCATION, TRAUMA RECOVERY AND CARE FOR THE MOST VULNERABLE. EGYPT - THE BIBLE SOCIETY OF EGYPT HAS TRANSFORMED AN American Bible Society BIBLICAL VIDEO SERIES INTO A TRAVELING CHRISTIAN OUTREACH FESTIVAL. IN FY 2010, MORE THAN 100,000 EGYPTIAN CHILDREN LEARNED LESSONS FROM KINGO, THE LOVABLE LION CHARACTER, WHO BRINGS THEM CHRIST'S MESSAGE OF LOVE AND COMPASSION. BEFORE LEAVING THE FESTIVALS, EACH CHILD IS GIVEN SCRIPTURE RESOURCES WITH AN INVITATION TO ENGAGE IN ONGOING DISCIPLESHIP OPPORTUNITIES WITH LOCAL CHURCHES. INDIA - MANY WIDOWS IN INDIA FACE SEVERE SOCIO-ECONOMIC PRESSURES AND ARE TARGETS FOR PHYSICAL AND SEXUAL ABUSE - SOMETIMES AT THE HANDS OF THEIR OWN FAMILY MEMBERS. OVER A PERIOD OF FIVE YEARS, THE BIBLE SOCIETY OF INDIA, IN PARTNERSHIP WITH American Bible Society AND LOCAL AGENCIES, WILL IMPLEMENT REGIONAL AND LOCAL WORKSHOPS TO EDUCATE, TRAIN, EQUIP AND PROVIDE HOPE TO WIDOWS WITHIN CHRISTIAN COMMUNITIES. SCRIPTURE IS AN ESSENTIAL COMPONENT AS THE WOMEN FIND HOPE AND HEALING THROUGH GOD'S WORD. NEW AND NEEDED TRANSLATIONS - AMERICAN BIBLE SOCIETY, IN PARTNERSHIP WITH THE SEED COMPANY AND NATIONAL BIBLE SOCIETIES, IS WORKING ON THE TRANSLATION OF GOD'S WORD IN 56 LANGUAGES. REVISED CHINESE UNION VERSION - AMERICAN BIBLE SOCIETY AND LEADERS FROM THE HONG KONG BIBLE SOCIETY VISITED CONGREGATIONS IN SOME OF THE LARGEST U.S. CHINESE COMMUNITIES - NEW YORK, SAN FRANCISCO, LOS ANGELES AND HOUSTON - TO INTRODUCE THE LONG-AWAITED REVISED CHINESE UNION VERSION OF THE BIBLE. THIS IS THE FIRST CHINESE LANGUAGE UPDATE TO THE BIBLE SINCE 1919. THIS PROJECT OFFERED UNIQUE CHALLENGES. THE EXISTING CHINESE UNION VERSION IS FILLED WITH CHARACTERS THAT ARE NO LONGER COMMONLY USED BY THE 70 MILLION CHINESE CHRISTIANS WORLDWIDE AND CAN BE CONFUSING TO MODERN CHINESE READERS IN THE MORE THAN 300,000 CHINESE CHURCHES ACROSS THE GLOBE. TO REMEDY THIS, SCHOLARS FROM MAINLAND CHINA, HONG KONG, TAIWAN, MALAYSIA, SINGAPORE, AUSTRALIA AND The United States of AMERICA GOT TOGETHER TO CREATE THE RCUV BIBLE, WHICH WAS CAREFULLY DESIGNED TO BE FREE OF LANGUAGE BIASES BASED ON REGIONALISM OR DIALECT. GETTING THE MOST FROM EVERY MINISTRY INVESTMENT AMERICAN BIBLE SOCIETY HAS CREATED A DISCIPLINE IN REVIEWING PROGRAMS THROUGH GLOBAL SCRIPTURE IMPACT (GSI). GSI WAS CREATED IN ORDER TO GIVE THE AMERICAN BIBLE SOCIETY THE PROJECT IMPACT EVALUATION AND ANALYSIS REQUIRED TO INFORM MINISTRY INVESTMENT DECISIONS THAT RESULT IN THE FUNDING OF MORE EFFECTIVE MINISTRY PROGRAMS WITH VERIFIED PROJECT IMPACT. OVER THE LAST 24 MONTHS, GSI HAS RESEARCHED MORE THAN 310 MINISTRY PROJECTS IN MORE THAN 52 COUNTRIES. GSI RESEARCH SERVICES ARE PROVIDED BY A TEAM OF EXPERIENCED RESEARCH ANALYSTS WHO HAVE A PROVEN TRACK RECORD OF MINISTRY PROGRAM DEVELOPMENT AND ANALYSIS. GSI RESEARCHERS ARE INTERNATIONALLY DIVERSE, WITH EXPERIENCE AS MINISTRY LEADERS, PROGRAM LEADERS OF NONGOVERNMENTAL ORGANIZATIONS, COMMUNITY HEALTH EXPERTS, UNIVERSITY AND SEMINARY EDUCATORS AND FINANCIAL ANALYSTS IN DOMESTIC AND INTERNATIONAL LOCATIONS. AT THE END OF THE PROJECT PERIOD, PROJECTS ARE REVIEWED FOR EFFECTIVENESS WITH AN EVALUATION OF PERFORMANCE AGAINST THE OBJECTIVES STATED IN THE RESEARCH LOG FRAME. THE EVALUATION INCLUDES A BUDGET COMPARISON BASED ON ACTUAL SPENDING, THE RESEARCH ANALYST'S ASSESSMENT AND RECOMMENDATIONS AND BENEFICIARY TESTIMONIES. THE RECENTLY EXPANDED FOUR-PAGE FORMAT ALLOWS FOR MORE THOROUGH REPORTING OF RESEARCH FINDINGS AND ANALYSIS TO BETTER INFORM FUTURE FUNDING DECISIONS. FOR MULTIYEAR PROJECTS, A PROGRESS REPORT IS AVAILABLE FOR MILESTONE EVALUATION. PROJECTS ARE SELECTED FOR GSI RESEARCH BY THE AMERICAN BIBLE SOCIETY'S SENIOR LEADERSHIP (national AND INTERNATIONAL) TO SUPPORT THE STRATEGIC PLANNING AND EVALUATION OF GLOBAL SCRIPTURE MINISTRY (GSM) ACTIVITIES. GSI CONDUCTS ACTION RESEARCH OF ORGANIZATIONS AND THE PROJECTS UNDER FOCUS. IN FY 2010, GSI RESEARCHED PROJECTS THAT COULD POTENTIALLY IMPACT 3.66 MILLION LIVES. THE SUBSEQUENT IMPACT REPORTS ARE DEVELOPED TO PROVIDE INDEPENDENT ANALYSIS AND DONOR ENGAGEMENT MATERIALS. THE REPORTS ALSO SERVE AS A TOOL FOR THE PROJECT IMPLEMENTER TO DEVELOP A DEEPER UNDERSTANDING OF the project's WORK AND IMPACT. ONCE THE PROJECT THAT WAS STUDIED IS FUNDED, THE IMPACT ASSESSMENT PROCESS BEGINS. WHEN AN IMPACT ASSESSMENT IS COMPLETED, THE SCORING IS SUMMARIZED AS EXCEEDED, ACHIEVED OR BELOW PROJECT GOALS. AMERICAN BIBLE SOCIETY WILL DETERMINE WHETHER A PROJECT CAN BE MAINTAINED, CHANGED OR ELIMINATED BASED UPON ITS ASSESSMENT. OUR ASSESSMENT PROCESS LEADS TO THE DEVELOPMENT OF BETTER PROGRAMS WITH INCREASED IMPACT AND EFFECTIVE STEWARDSHIP OF RESOURCES THAT OUR DONORS ENTRUST US WITH. CENTRAL TO THE American Bible Society's EVALUATION PROCESS IS THE METRIC OF WILLINGNESS, UNDERSTANDING AND ACTION (WUA). THIS GSI TOOL IS USED TO EVALUATE THE LEVEL OF THE BENEFICIARIES' ENGAGEMENT WITH SCRIPTURE THROUGH THE PROJECT. FOR EXAMPLE, A WILLINGNESS SCORE COULD BE THE NUMBER OF PEOPLE WILLING TO ATTEND A JESUS FILM EVENT USING A NEW TRANSLATION BY A NATIONAL BIBLE SOCIETY; UNDERSTANDING COULD BE PEOPLE INCREASING THEIR UNDERSTANDING OF SCRIPTURE BY ATTENDING BIBLE STUDY REGULARLY USING THE PRINTED OR AUDIO VERSION OF THE NEW TRANSLATION; AND ACTION COULD BE EVIDENCE OF POSITIVE CHANGES IN PEOPLE'S LIVES BASED ON SCRIPTURE, SUCH AS BECOMING A BIBLE STUDY LEADER AND VOLUNTEERING TO WORK FOR THE LOCAL CHURCH. HIGHLIGHTS FOR THE YEAR AHEAD: THIS NEXT YEAR, American Bible Society IS PROJECTING GROWTH INITIATIVES THAT WILL RESULT IN AN INCREASE FROM 8.1 TO 9.8 MILLION PEOPLE WHO ARE REACHED BY BIBLE SOCIETY ACTIVITIES. BELOW IS A BRIEF SUMMARY OF SOME KEY INITIATIVES PLANNED FOR THE COMING FISCAL YEAR IN EACH MINISTRY AREA. ESSENTIAL ENGAGEMENT NATIONAL SCRIPTURE ENGAGEMENT CAMPAIGN American Bible Society IS PREPARING TO LAUNCH THE NATIONAL SCRIPTURE ENGAGEMENT CAMPAIGN, "UNCOVER THE WORD." THIS CAMPAIGN WILL BE AN ALL-ENCOMPASSING, NATIONWIDE INITIATIVE TO INVITE AND ENCOURAGE AMERICANS TO ENGAGE WITH SCRIPTURE ON A DAILY BASIS. EMBODYING HOPE "MISSION: LITERA

Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Identifier: COLLECTIONS OF ART, HISTORICAL TREASURES OR OTHER SIMILAR ASSETS
Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Explanation: The American Bible Society, ("the Bible Society"), maintains a rare scripture collection held for exhibition, education and research which has been acquired through purchases and contributions since the Bible Society's inception. The Bible Society maintains policies and procedures addressing the collection's upkeep and management. The Bible Society has adopted the policy of not capitalizing its collection, which is insured at a value of approximately $12 million. Purchases of collections are recorded as decreases in unrestricted net assets in the year in which the items are acquired. In January 2010, part of the library collection was loaned to the Museum of Biblical Art ("MOBIA") for 5 years for purposes of conservation and exhibition.

The American Bible Society's endowment funds (quasi & true permanently restricted endowment) exist to support the organization's mission. The unrestricted funds (quasi-endowment) help subsidize the operating budget via an annual spending formula, which allows more current donor contributions to directly fund programs. A spending formula is also applied to the restricted funds (true endowment) and is appropriated for both general and specific purposes as designated by original donor intent. The Bible Society maintains the historical principal value on true endowments.

In July 2006, new guidance was issued in the area of "Accounting for Uncertainty in Income Taxes." The new standard clarifies the accounting for uncertainty in tax positions taken or expected to be taken in a tax return, including issues relating to financial statement recognition and measurement. This standard provides that the tax effects from an uncertain tax position can be recognized in the financial statements only if the position is "more-likely-than-not" to be sustained if the position were to be challenged by a taxing authority. The standard also provides guidance on measurement, classification, interest and penalties, and disclosure. It was effective for the Bible Society on July 1, 2009, and had no material impact on the accompanying financial statements. The tax years ended 2007, 2008, and 2009 are still open to audit for both federal and state purposes. The Bible Society has processes presently in place to ensure the maintenance of its tax-exempt status; to identify and report unrelated income; to determine its filing and tax obligations in jurisdictions for which it has nexus; and to identify and evaluate other matters that may be considered tax positions.

AcctsActvsOutUSTable.Region: Russia and the Newly Independent States

Form990ScheduleFPartIV.Explanation: The American Bible Society (ABS) is a member of the United Bible Societies (UBS), a world-wide fellowship of national Bible Societies. The UBS solicits and researches various Bible distribution projects proposed by the national Bible Societies and makes such projects available to the fellowship (Including ABS) for funding. ABS signs a research and funding agreement with beneficiaries of ABS grants. This allows us to monitor and evaluate funds sent to each country. Global Scripture Impact ("GSI"), our internal research group, or our funding partner researches each project before funding it for project impact (life change), goal alignment, financial risks; environmental risk, managerial risks (implementer on the ground) and other project inherent risks. Quarterly progress reports, from implementer or partner allow us to monitor use of funds as funded project progresses. At the end of the project GSI or partner conducts an assessment of results to compare with plan and budget. Information on results is relayed to management and donor constituency. Unused funds are retrieved from implementer and the donor's permission to redirect funds to similar projects in other countries is obtained. ABS conducts field visits to projects in different countries to validate information. Some of these visits are done with participation of major donors of projects. Our overall international investment is closely monitored internally by different specially appointed groups (task forces, ad-hoc groups or committees) and duly reported to our Board on a quarterly basis.

Form990ScheduleIPartIV.Explanation: The American Bible Society has formed a department to evaluate and assess the worthiness and effectiveness of requested project grant amounts, both before the grant is issued, and after the grant and project have been completed. Detailed reports (Impact Statements) are prepared using a standard methodology of financial and life impact measurement for management decision in grant approval and post project evaluation of effectiveness and grant compliance.

Form990ScheduleJPartIII.Explanation: Form 990, Schedule J, LINE 1A: The American Bible Society's ("the Bible Society") travel Policy provides for spousal travel in limited circumstances where there is a pre-approved, defined/measureable Bible Society business purpose. The Bible Society does provide a clergy housing allowance to several officers and directors reported on Part VII and Schedule J of the Form 990. The clergy allowance is provided to ordained staff members and is reported in Schedule J, Part II, column (b)(i). Consistent with its 194-year commitment to having a home base in the heart of New York City and also recognizing this as one of the nation's most expensive metros, the Bible Society, likewise, provides the president with the use of a cleaned, rented corporate apartment when he is in New York City. This benefit is taxable to the president and is reported in Schedule J, part II, column (b)(i). Finally, all Bible Society staff members are provided health club membership cost reimbursement up to $250/year. All amounts are treated as taxable income, reported on form W-2 and disclosed on Form 990 unless excluded by the Internal Revenue Code as a working condition benefit or reimburseable business expense. Schedule J, Part I, Line 4a: Former CFO and COO, Richard Stewart, separated from service from the Bible Society in the prior fiscal year. Mr. Stewart received $288,936 in severance pay that has been reported on the Form 990, Schedule J, Part II, column (b)(iii). There is no further payment to be made to Mr. Stewart.

Form990ScheduleMPartII.Explanation: All contributed securities are transferred into a brokerage account for ultimate sale by the American Bible Society's investment brokers.

GeneralExplanation.Explanation: Section B: Policies Line 11: The Form 990 was reviewed by nationally renowned accounting firm, grant thornton, in conjunction with the organization's financial department. A copy of the draft Form 990 was circulated to the full Board of Trustees for discussion and comment. Each Board Member was provided ample opportunity to comment on the information contained in the 990 prior to its filing with the Internal Revenue Service. Line 12: Employees are continually trained by the legal staff in conflict of interest awareness and are required to file conflict of interest disclosure statements annually. Conflicts identified are investigated by the internal audit staff for resolution with management and the Board Audit Committee. Line 15: Compensation for the President & CEO is determined by a compensation committee appointed by the Board of Trustees. The compensation committee relies on a number of different sources to determine compensaiton, including, but not limtied to, compensation benchmark surveys and studies, compensation paid to similar officers at similar institutions (i.e. by reviewing the Form 990 of other organizations), and recommendations from an independent compensation consultant. The Compensation Committee is a Committee of the Board of Trustees. The commitee recommends the CEO compensation to the full board of trustees for its approval. The compensation is then formalized in a written employment agreement that is signed by the Chairman of the Board and the President & CEO. Compensation for other officers and key employees of the organization is determined using various sources by Human Resources such as compensation surveys and studies, including information on Form 990 of other organizations as well as recommendations from an independent compensation consultant. Human Resources then obtains approval for the recommended compensation from the officer and key employees' next higher level manager. Final compensation amount is then communicated to the officer and key employee by Human Resources. Section C: Disclosure Line 19: The American Bible Society ("the Bible Society") makes its Form 990 and audited financial statements available on its website, www.americanbible.org. The Bible Society's governing documents and conflict of interest statement are available upon request and at management's discretion.
Aside from the states listed in Schedule G, The Bible Society is in the process of registering in the State of Hawaii.
Austria Brazil Egypt Belgium Germany Hong Kong Hungary India Indonesia Korea Malaysia Mexico Singapore South Africa Thailand Turkey United Kingdom

The American Bible Society allocated $1,084,118 of the fees it paid to Stratmark to fundraising expenditures in its audited financial statements. For fiscal year 2009, Stratmark was paid $5,251,549. The difference between the $5,251,549 and $1,084,119 was reported in the financial statements as program service expenditures. The Bible Society has opted to report its expenditures consistent with the financial statements; accordingly, it is reporting $1,084,118 on Part IX, Line 11(e). Stratmark is one of the Bible Society's top five highest paid independent contractors. Since Form 990, Part VII is prepared on a calendar year basis, the amount of compensation paid to Stratmark is reported as $4,626,177. Form 990 Schedule G, Part I The amounts reported on Schedule G for Stratmark represent amounts paid both to Stratmark and to companies Stratmark subcontracts with. For purposes of greater clarity, the Bible Society is providing the following breakdown of the $8,096,000 in fees and expenses as reported on Schedule G. Paid to Stratmark $5,251,549 Paid to subcontractor - Synergy $47,755 Paid to subcontractor - MDS $638,715 Paid to subcontractor - Response world $305,471 Paid to subcontractor - Donor Care $63,613 Reimburemsent for Postage Paid $1,788,798 Total Fees $8,096,000 (rounded) All invoices are processed by Stratmark.

The American Bible Society lists 36 Board of DIrectors members on its Form 990. Father Cutie and Monsignor Harris were on leave of absence during the year and therefore were not voting members at year end. Reverend Argue and Ms. Binkley ceased board service prior to the year end. Accordingly, the Bible Society is reporting 32 voting members of the Board of Directors. The President of the American Bible Society is a voting member of the board of directors. Since he is compensated, the Bible Society is reporting 31 independent voting members of the Board of Directors.
